outputs.output_descr:
The implementation of the HCFC Phase-out Management Plan (HPMP), stage I, will result in the freeze in consumption in 2013 and the 10% reduction in consumption of HCFCs in Moldova by 2015, resulting in a phase out of 4.15 mt (0.23 ODP tonnes), as this obligation is taken by the Government of Moldova under the Montreal Protocol on the Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer.
Moldova has requested financial support from the Multilateral Fund for the activities stipulated in the HPMP document. With these allocated funds Moldova will undertake regulatory measures incl. necessary amendments to the national legislation and technical capacity development, including strengthening of the vocational training, training of technicians, awareness raising activities, strengthening the capacities of the Public Association of the Refrigeration Technicians, and train customs officer and monitor the progress of implantation of all HPMP activities.

project_descr: Implementation of the Hydrochlorofluorocarbons Phase-out Management Plan,   Stage 1
